meanings.definition: To steal (something, especially something of small value) in a casual way.
meanings.sent1: He would filch candies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous raccoon would filch shiny objects from the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel decided to filch nuts from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to filch coins from thin air during his performance.
meanings.sent5: The pickpocket was skilled at filching wallets without being noticed.

meanings.definition: To take (something) for oneself, typically in a stealthy or casual way.
meanings.sent1: She would filch a cookie from the jar when her mom wasn't looking.
meanings.sent2: The cat would filch fish from the kitchen counter when no one was around.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to filch a toy from his friend's room without getting caught.
meanings.sent4: The thief managed to filch the priceless painting from the museum undetected.
meanings.sent5: The spy was able to filch confidential documents without raising suspicion.
